ygData.subject: Re: Skill training while you sleep.
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Worlord  To:  Sent: Monday, February 21, 2000 4:19 PM Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Skill training while you
ygData.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: Worlord <worlord@...>
To: <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, February 21, 2000 4:19 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Skill training while you sleep.


> From: Worlord <worlord@...>
>
> Verant doesn't want you to be able to do this or else they would have
> made macro programs usable... if a GM found you, you would most likely
> be banned. There was a great deal of problem with this in UO, Verant
> has tried hard not to make it a problem in Everquest.
>
> --
>
> Hammeron
> Monk of Quellious
> Karana
>
> --
> Worlord
> worlord@...


Heh, reason I quit EQ is because Everlevel got rather boring, as there
was no point to it after hitting level 50, (And their pvp was terrible).
AC... Well.. Thats different... AC is boring and worthless unless you play
on a pvp server, then it gets interesting. Also... someone 5 or even 10
levels above you cant just kill you off the bat... If you get ahead in the
fight then you can win too...

If you hate zones, AC is good too.

Its also possible to kill monsters much higher level than you, thus
faster and less tedious leveling

Thats all I have to say, now back to raising my archer up to level 10
so I can hit the golem burial grounds...

--
Darkblade,
"When is Verant gonna realize they created a dead game?"
